intro: Hieracium boreale proles dispalatum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. This species is often found in mountainous areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
